page.title: 01SUTTON & STEETON MOORS.
page.content: The area covered by D-block is mostly high rough grassland or moorland used for grazing of sheep or for silage.The highest point is 350m above sea level. The edges of the villages of Laycock, Braithwaite and Sutton figure in the area but apart from that,the only settlements are farmhouses of which there are about 20.All the villages are linked by steep winding lanes and eventually to Keighley.There are few amenities in the block except a school and a chapel in Braithwaite and a pub, garage and shop in Sutton. Several streams serve the area which is millstone grit.Waterlogging occurs, although due to the slopes, the water flows into the valley.There is a reservoir and also Redcar Tarn. Places of interest are Sutton Clough and Redcar Tarn.
